name: In re Estate of Charles Bryant. Appeal of J. Edward Carpenter, Escheator for the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania

judges: Before Sterrett, C. J., McCollum, Mitchell, Dean and Fell, JJ.
parties: In re Estate of Charles Bryant. Appeal of J. Edward Carpenter, Escheator for the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.

opinions.text:
Opinion by
Mr. Justice Mitchell,
For reasons set forth in the opinion filed herewith in Bryant’s Estate, George E. Bryant’s Appeal, ante, p. 309, this appeal is dismissed.
Appeal dismissed with costs.
opinions.author: Mr. Justice Mitchell,

casebody.head_matter:
In re Estate of Charles Bryant. Appeal of J. Edward Carpenter, Escheator for the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
Argued March 30, 1896.
July 15, 1896:
Appeal, No. 35, July T., 1895, by J. Edward Carpenter, Esq., escheator for the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, from decree of O. C. Phila. Co., July T., 1894, No. 182, awarding estate to English claimants.
Before Sterrett, C. J., McCollum, Mitchell, Dean and Fell, JJ.
Affirmed.
The facts appear in the report of the next preceding case, Bryant’s Est., ante, p. 309.
Error assigned, among others, was, not awarding balance in tie lands of the accountant to the commonwealth as an escheat.
Richard M. Qadwalader, for appellant.
William W. Ker, for appellee.
